item.title: Live Unit Testing with .NET and Visual Studio
item.description: A few days ago I was looking for something related to unit tests in the Microsoft documentation. I came to the tab titled ‘Live unit testing’ and I decided to check what is it. It is quite interesting, because why I have to click to run unit tests when I made small changes in code? We have the live reload functionality in frontend or some mobile technologies to see changes in the interface, so the developer don’t have manually click F5 to refresh the page.

item.title: Contact
item.description: You can contact with me by writing an email: piotr (at) wachulec.me or by social media. All of my socials you can find on main page or on my profile on SocialsHub.

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi! My name is Piotr. Let me tell you something about me.
Technically Currently C#/.NET developer with about 2 years of commercial experience in these technologies. Also associated with Microsoft Azure cloud for two years (I passed AZ-900 exam). Most projects used: .NET Core 2.1+ Azure App Service Azure SQL Database Azure Functions Storage Account Cosmos DB VMs SignalR Logic Apps Azure AD/Graph API Key Vault I have experience also with other Azure services.
